header.description: Center for Cancer Care Foundation (CCCF) is a voluntary, non-profit social organization for cancer patients and cancer survivors, family members of those affected, family members who have lost loved ones to cancer, relatives, friends, specialist doctors, and those interested in working for cancer prevention.

slides.subTitle: Stand by Cancer Warriors
slides.title: Center for Cancer Care Foundation (CCCF)
slides.description: We work for cancer patients, survivors and their families. Awareness, counseling and essential information services are our main goals.

slides.subTitle: Every Life Matters
slides.title: Support Cancer Patients & Survivors
slides.description: Join us in our mission to provide counseling, information services, and support to cancer warriors and their caregivers across Bangladesh.

slides.subTitle: Together We Can Win
slides.title: Cancer Awareness & Prevention
slides.description: Through our 'Jani O Janai' program and community outreach, we aim to reduce cancer rates through education and early detection.

about.subTitle: About Us
about.description: CCCF officially started its journey on June 3, 2023 by honoring cancer survivors. Earlier, on February 4, 2023, on World Cancer Day, a few of us survivors and caregivers gathered for an experience sharing and reunion meeting. The overwhelming response from everyone there urged us to do something seriously. In continuation of that urge, we formed the Center for Cancer Care Foundation (CCCF). In previous events, we started working under the name 'Cancer Care Community, Bangladesh'. Later the name was changed to CCCF.
about.fundraisingDesc: Our main objective is to reduce the rate of cancer incidence in the country and ensure a healthy life for those affected by receiving timely treatment through experience sharing among cancer patients and survivors, information exchange, counseling, and increasing awareness about cancer screening, which will reduce the treatment burden.
about.donationDesc: Cancer counseling services (online and face-to-face), essential information services for cancer patients, 'Pase Achi' (Mugdha Smriti Scholarship), cancer awareness program 'Jani O Janai', breast self-examination training and practice, volunteer training.
about.name: Rokshana Afroz

publications.subTitle: Publications
publications.description: CCCF has published two books titled 'Ekhane Themo Na: Cancer Lorakuder Boyan' (Don't Stop Here: Narratives of Cancer Warriors) and 'Ekhane Themo Na: Cancer Lorakuk O Poricharokder Boyan' (Don't Stop Here: Narratives of Cancer Warriors and Caregivers), where 42 cancer survivors and 35 caregivers have written. Besides, a third book with writings by specialists is also forthcoming.

janiJanai.subTitle: Regular Program
janiJanai.titlePart1: now and Let Know (Jani O Janai)
janiJanai.description: With the aim of increasing cancer awareness and providing information on treatment and prevention of various cancers, we organize an online program titled 'Jani O Janai' every month. Cancer warriors, survivors and experts share their experiences and opinions. So far, 31 episodes of this series have been broadcast online.

volunteerProgram.title: Volunteer Training
volunteerProgram.description: CCCF has involved young people as volunteers. Already 70 students from various educational institutions have been involved as volunteers. Training is underway to make them skilled as cancer caregivers. After training, they will be able to provide services to patients in hospitals or at home.

members.assistant_general_secretary: Dr. Abu Jamil Faisal & Noor Muhammad (Assistant General Secretaries)

advisoryCouncil.title: Advisory Council
members: Captain Dr. Sitara Begum, Bir Protik
Agricultural Scientist Dr. Mohammad Zainul Abedin

proposals.title: Our Important Proposals
items: We want quality, modern and adequate cancer treatment services to be developed at an affordable cost for all people regardless of nationality, religion, caste, gender, age, where the satisfaction of the patient and their relatives will be considered a priority.
We want a 'National Cancer Fund' to be formed with the participation of all sections of society under a state initiative to meet the treatment costs of cancer patients in the country.
We want a comprehensive cancer screening system to be developed at the community level for early cancer prevention.
We want a timely and effective cancer policy and national cancer control plan to be adopted for the general public.
We want to ensure adequate cancer counseling facilities in every hospital in the country. Professional cancer counselors should be appointed.
We want the cost of essential medicines and tests for cancer patients to be within the reach of the general public.
We want everyone in society to be cooperative in returning to normal life after cancer treatment. Ensure proper rehabilitation for them.
We want the promotion of cancer-risk foods and products in all types of media to be stopped. At the same time, mass media should come forward to increase awareness about cancer.

item1.title: Cancer Counseling
item1.desc: Providing counseling services online and face-to-face.

item2.title: Information Service
item2.desc: Providing essential information to cancer patients.

item1.title: Formation of National Cancer Fund
item1.desc: Proposal to form a fund with the participation of all sections of society under a state initiative.

item2.title: Comprehensive Cancer Screening System
item2.desc: Arranging extensive cancer screening at the community level for early prevention.

item3.title: Enactment of Cancer Policy
item3.desc: Adopting a timely and effective cancer policy and national cancer control plan for the general public.

item4.title: Ensuring Cancer Counseling
item4.desc: Establishing adequate cancer counseling facilities in every hospital and appointing professional cancer counselors.

item5.title: Affordable Medicine and Tests
item5.desc: Ensuring the cost of essential medicines and tests for cancer patients remains within the reach of the general public.

item6.title: Ensuring Rehabilitation System
item6.desc: Ensuring social cooperation and rehabilitation arrangements for cancer patients to return to normal life after treatment.

item7.title: Stop Promotion of Risky Products
item7.desc: Stopping the promotion of cancer-risk foods and products in all types of mass media.

item8.title: Increase Awareness in Mass Media
item8.desc: Calling upon mass media to come forward to increase awareness about cancer.

item1.text: I feel inspired to write in CCCF's book 'Ekhane Themo Na'. My cancer battle story will be courage for others.
item1.name: John Doe

item2.text: I am glad to share my experience as a caregiver. CCCF has given us a platform.
item2.name: Jane Smith

counter.subTitle: Statistics
counter.titlePart1: e Are Always by the Side of Helpless People
counter.description: Through cancer awareness, counseling and training, we are providing service.

faq.subTitle: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Donation not only alleviates suffering but also creates unity and a sense of responsibility in society. It reminds us that our small contribution can bring a big change in someone's life.

questions.question: How does CCCF help cancer patients?
questions.answer: We provide support through cancer counseling, essential information services, 'Pase Achi' scholarship, and awareness program 'Jani O Janai'.

questions.question: How can I become a volunteer?
questions.answer: You can contact us through our website or email to join as a volunteer and receive training.

questions.question: Where can I watch 'Jani O Janai' program?
questions.answer: You can watch all episodes on our YouTube channel 'www.youtube.com/@cccf23'.

questions.question: What are our important proposals?
questions.answer: Formation of National Cancer Fund, community screening, enactment of cancer policy, ensuring counseling services etc. are our main proposals.

questions.question: What is the registration number of CCCF?
questions.answer: Our registration number is: DHA-010075. Visit www.cccfbd.org for details.
